column1: Symptoms may include: - Abdominal pain - Anxiety - Burning of the mouth or the throat - Convulsions - Excessive thirst - Excitation - Hallucinations - Muscle spasms - Nausea and vomiting - Rapid pulse - Restlessness or agitation - Rigid muscles - Skin irritation - Slow breathing - Somnolence (sleepiness) - Thirst - Tremors (unintentional trembling) - Twitching facial muscles - Unconsciousness

The person may receive: - Activated charcoal (used if other substances were taken along with the camphor, since activated charcoal does not adsorb camphor very well) - Airway support, including oxygen, breathing tube through the mouth (intubation),and ventilator (breathing machine) - Blood and urine tests - Chest x-ray - EKG (electrocardiogram, or heart tracing) - Fluids through the vein (intravenous or IV) - Laxative - Medicines to treat symptoms
